did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Papers of Collins Denny 1886-1958 and n. d.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Collins Denny, Accession #2672-i, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Collection contains journals, 1880 & 1886-87 of Denny's trips to Europe & around the world, correspondence, 1886-87 regarding the trip & correspondence, 1939-40 regarding Denny's refusal to become a bishop in the United Methodist Church, reports, clippings, photographs, scrapbook, 1931 from his 50th wedding anniversary, personal notebook, 1893-1910 and Denny family Bible records.

did.unittitle: 6 letters from Bishops McTyerie, Hendrix, and W. R. Denny re: Trip around the world. 1886
8 letters of introduction for Collins Denny. ca. 1886
7 invitations to Collins Denny while on his trip around the world. ca. 1886-1887
6 letters of Recommendation for Collins Denny to Chancelor Garland. 1890
6 membership cards, N. S. D. A. R., of various members of the Denny family. 1895-1932
Newspaper clippings and typescript re: Collins Denny's aid in World War I. ca. 1923
AMSs, "A Joint Statement By Five Bishops" signed by Collins Denny, U. V. W. Darlington, et al ca. 1924
19 letters to and from various church officials re: Unification and publication of articles on Unification. 1936-1937
20 letters to and from officials in Methodist Church and Unification Conference. 1939 May-Sept.
AM, with mimeographed and printed copies: Collins Denny's letter to the Methodist Unification Conference. 1939 April
28 letters and telegrams to and from the Unification Conference re: refusal to become a Bishop. 1939 Jan.-May
15 letters to and from the General Conference re: refusal to become a Bishop. 1940 April June
3 TL copies, Collins Denny, Jr. to various Methodist Church officials concerning his father. 1943 May 20, July 23, Aug. 10
TL (carbon copy), [Collins Denny, Jr.] to R. H. Woody re: disposition of papers of Collins Denny. 1947 July 8
AMS, "Provisional Plan of Organization for purpose of pertuating the Methodist Episcopal Church...in South Caroline..." n. d.
AMSs, "Minority Report of the Committee on the Status of the Negro" by Collins Denny and H. H. White. n. d.
AM, Floor plan of a house n. d.
Journal of a trip through Europe by Collins Denny 1880 July-Oct.
Vol. I of a Journal of a trip around the world by Collins Denny 1886-1887
Vol. II of a Journal of a trip around the world by Collins Denny 1886-1887
Photograph of Collins Denny, William H. Baker, J. Montgomery MacFarland, William J. Manning, and William H. Whittlesey. 1872 Dec. 25
Docket of Collins Denny 1877
Cash Book of Collins Denny 1877 Sept.
3 Account Books of Collins Denny. ca. 1881-1886
Diary of [W. R. Denny] containing genealogical notes and accounts of a trip to Europe. ca. 1893-1910
"Catalogue of the Vanderbilt Chapter, Phi Beta Kappa", 85 pp., with notice of Collins Denny, p. 66. 1914
Scrapbook of Wedding Anniversary cards ca. 1931
Biographical sketch of Oswald Thomas Denny, 1849-1927 1949
"The First Hundred Years of Braddock St. Methodist Church." (Home church of Collins Denny in his youth.) 1958
2 photocopies of Denny Bible records.
